intro: Microstylis odorata, commonly known as the fragrant microstylis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked despite their subtle fragrance. Microstylis odorata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as wetlands and forest floors. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic study.
